containment:
SCP-002 must stay connected to a power supply to remain in recharging mode.
During power outages, the area is evacuated and sealed until power is restored,
followed by X-ray and UV light bursts before reconnecting SCP-002.
The containment area must have negative air pressure, and teams of two must stay
within 20 meters, maintaining physical contact to prevent perceptual distortions.
Only Level 3 personnel or higher can access SCP-002 unless authorized by two Level 4 administrators.
Authorized staff are escorted by security, lose clearance temporarily, and must undergo
quarantine and evaluation before returning to duty.
description:
SCP-002 resembles a tumorous growth about 60 m³ in size,
with an iron valve hatch leading to its interior,
which resembles a modest low-rent apartment.
One wall has a window not visible from the outside.
The furniture inside appears to be made of biological materials like bone and hair,
each showing unique or fragmented human DNA sequences.

containment:
SCP-3 must be kept at temperatures above 35°C, ideally above 100°C.
No living organisms of Category IV or higher complexity may contact SCP-3.
In case of power failure, personnel must maintain skin contact with SCP-3-1
to keep it above critical temperature until it advances to the second growth stage.
Personnel must be checked for parasites and sterilized after contact with SCP-3-1.
SCP-3-1 must remain in SCP-3-2, with any changes in rune activity reported within three hours.
SCP-3-2 must be powered by Generator 3-IX at all times.
description:
SCP-3 consists of SCP-3-1, a chitinous, biological component resembling an ancient motherboard,
and SCP-3-2, a rune-covered stone tablet.
SCP-3-1 is sentient and grows in two stages when SCP-3 drops below 35°C.
In the first stage, it grows into a form similar to a brittle star, converting surrounding matter.
In the second stage, it interacts with living organisms, altering its growth rate and mimicking materials.
SCP-3-2 controls SCP-3-1 with internal radiation and an anomalous power source, likely designed to contain SCP-3-1.
SCP-3-1's biology shows similarities to other SCP objects but remains largely unexplained.

containment:
When handling SCP-004-2 through SCP-004-13, proper procedure is vital.
The items cannot be moved off-site without two Level 4 security personnel.
No other component of SCP-004 should be taken through SCP-004-1.
If SCP-004-1 is breached or the facility is compromised,
the keys must be brought inside and the door closed before activating Site 62’s warhead.
Unauthorized removal of keys is grounds for immediate termination.
Level 1 clearance is required for basic access to SCP-004-1; Level 4 clearance is required for use of SCP-004-2 to -13.
description:
SCP-004 consists of an old wooden barn door (SCP-004-1)
and a set of twelve rusted steel keys (SCP-004-2 through SCP-004-13).
The door is the entrance to an abandoned factory in [DATA EXPUNGED].

containment:
SCP-005 poses no immediate risk in any direct sense.
Even so, its unique functions require special measures be taken to restrict access and manipulation of the object.
Approval of at least one (1) Level 4 personnel is required for the removal of the object from its containment area.
description:
SCP-005 resembles an ornate key from the 1920s.
It was discovered when a civilian used it to infiltrate a high-security facility.
SCP-005 can open any lock, mechanical or digital, with ease.
The origin of this ability is undetermined.

containment:
Personnel interacting with SCP-006 must wear modified Class VI BNC suits.
Before procedures, personnel must be briefed with Material SCP-006B or SCP-006C.
SCP-006A Briefing is restricted to O5 clearance only.
To ensure proper suit usage, personnel must be submerged in water; bubbles indicate leaks.
Procedures with SCP-006 are under extreme surveillance.
In case of contact with SCP-006, the commander will announce Procedure 006-Xi-12, which means evacuation.
Liquid from SCP-006 must be approved by three O5 personnel, transferred in a Quad-Sealant Container under armed guard.
Personnel contacting SCP-006 or its liquid are to be confined and incinerated after studies.
description:
SCP-006 is a small spring located 60 km west of Astrakhan.
The Foundation was aware of it since the 19th century but secured it in 1991.
A chemical factory disguises the location, with laborers under Foundation or Russian control.
The liquid from SCP-006, initially identified as mineral water, has 'health' properties.
Ingesting it grants enhanced DNA repair, cellular duplication, tissue repair, and immune system effectiveness.
It destroys hostile bacteria and viruses in tested subjects, with varied effects on different species.
